headline.main: Big Study Program on Heart Attacks to Close Because of Fund Shortage

docs.abstract: Internationally-known Framingham (Mass) heart disease epidemiology study, major Natl Heart Inst study program which has collected invaluable data on heart attacks since '49, to close for lack of about $400,000 and about 20 staff positions; significance and uniqueness of data collected by study discussed; plan to close program was not formally announced but was noted briefly in pub of Amer Patients Assn, consumer group
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2 -- A major study program of the National Heart Institute, which has collected invaluable data on heart attack rests for almost 20 years, is being closed down for lack of about $400,000 and about 20 staff positions.
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2 -- A major study program of the National Heart Institute, which has collected invaluable data on heart attack rests for almost 20 years, is being closed down for lack of about $400,000 and about 20 staff positions.
